My hair is not quite as curly as the model on the cover, more like wavy or curly depending on the cut. Also had my hairdresser cut my hair differently taking advantage of my natural curl. All in all, one of the best hair care books I've found!

This straight to the point (the only straight thing about this) handbook for curly girls is a must for Any person with Any curl.  As a hairdresser and resident curly girl; I am grateful for the hardwork and trials that I know went into the journey(s) that conceived this manual. Full of testimonials structural knowledge of the curls themselves, chemical insights of products, Q&A's. This book covers everything curly except 'why is there no curly haired emoji? '  I'm excited about my new arsenal of curl knowledge and am now eager for more personal experience!

I too have fought my hair my whole life. I do not recall ever loving my hair. The one thing that has made a difference is know the Porosity (you can google this and how to test your hair for you Porosity) of my hair. Not one beautician has ever mentioned this. When I have mentioned this to different beauticians, some of them do not know what I am talking about. I have low Porosity and consider myself a 2C so to get a deep condition, I use natural conditioner and put on a shower cap over and set under a hard bonnett hair dryer for 30 minutes.The heat opens up my hair to asorb the conditioner. I have used a diffuser, air dried and used a hard bonnett hair dryer to dry my hair. During the week I air dry. I do sit under a hard hair bonnett dryer for the weekend. I use low heat and my hair is awesome! I use the Deva Clips under the dryer and it is an ionic dryer and my body is unbelievable!  It is really important as the CG book implies to stay away from all silicones, drying  Alcohols  and sulfates. Silicones are the worst for my hair type. Most Curly Products that are purchased have some sort of Silicones in them!  I have used the Deva Products and really do love them but I love looking for new products also that will meet the criteria of the CG Method. Once you are aware of what NOT to use, there are quite a bit of products available. I am still using trial and error and really enjoying trying this method. I will never go back to straightening or curling  my hair w/ a curling iron. I too get compliments daily on my hair. I think reading this book is a major step in knowing how to work with your curls. LOVE IT!!!

I got this book because I am transitioning to natural and I would hear mention of this book almost everywhere online. I eventually caved in after searching everything I could online via youtube/google thinking there may be another tidbit of information that I can utilize that I haven't found yet. Unfortunately for me I could of stuck with the information I gathered through other sources without reading this book and been just fine. However if you don't want to go through the hassle of filtering though vlogs, blogs, and would prefer to read the "Curly Girl" method from the source with multiple "woe is me until I found the 'Curly Girl' Method " tales scattered throughout the handbook than go for it.

This book is definitely a good place to start when you want to change your hair game from dry and frizzy to defined waves/curls. I’ve learned to tweak things to fit my hair and scalp (at least for now) that are different to the book, but I’m noticing substantially less frizz and way more bounce to my waves!I ended up purchasing both the kindle edition and then a hard copy as the videos wouldn’t play and the layout got a bit weird on the kindle edition.

I adore The Curly Girl Handbook. About 10 years ago, I read Curly Like Me and really learned a lot about curls, but there were product suggestions and techniques that did work for me. I had been seeing the “CG Method” on YouTube videos and loved the tips so I decided to make the plunge. I was pleasantly pleased it was attached to Deva. I love Deva products and the DevaCut saved my hair. However, this book DOES NOT push Deva and that is soooo refreshing. I really loved the trimming section. My hair is getting healthier and longer everyday!

I thought it was a little silly to buy a whole book jus ton hair care but this book has changed the way i do my hair. Great suggestions that actually work. My hair is way curlier and way less frizzy. hoping I can actually grow it long and have it keep it's curl with these new tips!

My little one's hair grew into beautiful blonde curls, had figured out a few things by trial and error but thankfully a neighbor told me about this book. What a great resource. Bought it again for a friend and share it w lots of friends and strangers. Seems like lots of curly haired ladies have read it at some point

I bought this book after doing lots of research on curly hair and trying to figure out what i could do with it, because i was so tired of straightning and damaging my hair. I had already used Deva Curl products before and liked them a lot. I learned a lot from this book and found out what porducts were good and what products were bad for curly hair. I would reccomend this book to anybody with curly hair trying to revive and learn how to properly take care of them.

Before I bought this book I was at the point of being so frustrated with my hair that I put it up in a bun every single day. It was so frizzy and awful. You couldn't tell that I even had curly hair, it just looked like a giant frizzy mess. After reading this book and buying the no poo shampoo, I have seen amazing results. It does take a little bit longer for my hair to get dry, but the results are well worth it. I have gotten so many compliments on my hair recently. People keep asking me if I used a curling iron in my hair! Most of my family and friends didn't even know I had curly hair since the only time they have seen me with my hair down is after flat ironing it. I am so happy I found this book.The only two negative things I have to say about this is that in the wind, my hair still will get a bit frizzy (still nothing compared to what it used to be though). I am also disappointed in the fact that the hair  products created by this author are pretty pricey. (Almost $60 for shampoo and conditioner combo 32oz!) She doesn't pressure you to use her product in the book which is nice, but it seems like there should be a more affordable option, or she should price her product somewhere the ordinary person wouldn't cringe at the price. I have found some recipes for no poo shampoo online that I will be trying once my bottle of deva curl shampoo runs out. Hopefully there is an inexpensive and still effective home recipe for this.But, in summary, if you have curly or frizzy hair you should read this book. You won't regret it!!

I have naturally curly hair and have searched for many years for the right products; some were made my hair stiff, some dryed it out, some didn't help with frizz, some made my hair flakey, some itchy...... this product is great! After carefully researching I found it reassuring to know that the lady, Lorraine Massey, who invented this line of products ACTUALLY HAS NATURALLY CURLY HAIR HERSELF!!! I purchased the deva curl gel, deva curl no poo, deva curl conditioner, and curly girl book - my experience with all of them together is fantastic! I am not kidding...ONE wash and gel using the method detailed for my hair in the book and it was a night and day difference!!! ONE wash and people I see every day were commenting on how great my hair looked literally overnight!! I only wish I could get to the Devachan salon to have a cut done by someone who actually knows how to cut curly hair!!Hats off to the Deva Girls from all of us curly girls!!! :)

It has a lot of helpful hints, suggestions and home made product recipes and I believe it is a good method and a good start to living with curly/ wavy hair. But every person’s hair is different and I have found that one product or one method isn’t the complete answer.  I would recommend the electronic version for a good place to start if your going back to your wonderful curls.

I love the book and the information. However I was extremely disappointed that the only how to video in the section for "ethnic curls" was done by a person that did not have typical Afro textured hair.  The book goes into detail about discrimination against curly haired people but purposely made a decision to exclude dense Afro textured hair.  The visual would have been very helpful for all of us fractal/zig zag curly girls.  For that it lost two stars. I still recommend the book. It will revolutionize your curls.  Update, the maximum hydration method is a modified curly girl routine for type 4 hair.  It has given me the curl definition and the wearable wash and go that I originally thought the curly girl method by itself would give me.
I’ve found more information online than in this book. This is mostly people’s personal stories of why they embraced their curly hair. There’s a small section for each hair type. Wish I could return.

This book has some good pointers, but is overly enthusiastic and rigid. The "no poo" method only works for some people, and it seems there is only one hairstyle featured. There is a tiny chapter for men, and she says she thinks men would probably want to spend less time on their hair than women, and was rather thin on details for shirt hair cuts. I am not a man, but I want a short haircut, and don't want to spend hours and hours on my hair. I gave this three stars because there is useful information in there, but I am definitely not a curly girl convert.

I have been pleasantly surprised by this book. I thought about buying it last year, but decided to put it off. Lucky for me, they came out with the updated version during that time and I bought, for about $8, the book and a DVD that came with it! I find it wonderful, that for such a small investment you receive so many great recipes (I've already tried 4 of them and have loved them all) and incomparable advice.I was born with straight hair, but when I hit adolescence, it turned wavy/curly. My hair type is some kind of mixture of both wavy (to about my ears) and botticelli curls according to the book, with a few other curl types thrown in, which is not at all uncommon (made me feel less weird to learn this).The book encourages you to embrace your natural hair type and shows you how to identify what types of curls you have and how to care for them in a way that won't drive you nuts. I don't feel like I've had a bad hair day since I first followed the advice for my closest hair type (wavy). I make my own flax seed hair gel for dirt cheap and use an inexpensive, cone-free conditioner for my routine.Ever since adolescence hit I've hated my hair, and on very few days have I actually felt happy with how it looked when I didn't do anything to it (and I like my hair low-maintenance, which meant I was unhappy with it but stuck most of the time). Since I have waist-length hair I gave up straightening a long time ago because the results never lasted long and took me 45 minutes or longer to do it.Only because of this book have I really started enjoying my hair. I have to admit - the scariest thing for me was "getting rid of" (I gave them to my husband to use!) my natural bristle hair brushes and combs and just using my fingers and oil to moisturize the length of my hair. But the improvements have been amazing and it is so nice not to need brushes anymore, believe it or not! My husband loves my newly more-pronounced, healthy-looking curls!My advice: buy the book! I'd be really surprised if you regretted it. The recipes are inexpensive and easy to try (my favorites are the exfoliating cleanser, lavender spray, and lemon aid) and the method only takes a couple of days to get the hang of (especially if you watch the DVD method a couple of times and then compare it with your hair type in the book)! For the first time my hair is so easy to do and I don't have to worry about it! This is a truly empowering book.

Gave me some great tips on how to care for my only curly head child. I haven't been able to too many changes, but with the ones that I have, her curls are finally staying curly instead of fizzing out. I do wish there were better pictures for the different types of curls esp since each description sounds a bit like her hair

I never knew "Swavy" was a thing.  My daughters have gorgeous curls and I've always thought my hair was too straight on top, but curly on the sides and back.  Now that I know how to use the right products, my curls are really coming out.  Love the guidance for all the types.  Wish I'd found this 40 years ago!

I didn't hear about Deva Curl until sometime after my BC in February 2010. I didn't understand, until I read Lorraine Massey's CG Handbook, how important she and Teri LaFlesh are to unlocking the mysteries of multi-cultural curly hair. Their books compliment each other. I read Lorraine's book and watched the DVD the same day it was delivered. I also read it again that Saturday and that Sunday. I felt there was important information for multi-cultural curlies that was missing. The before pics of two of the multi-cultural models on the DVD flashed by so quickly, I had to replay that section several times to get an idea of how their hair looked prior to the process. I get that there are only so many pages to a book and Lorraine was graciously inclusive. I particularly like that her products and techniques like Teri's are inclusive. I also read Teri's book as soon as I purchased it. I incorporate information and techniques from both ladies into my hair routines. I try to keep it as simple as possible. It's going to take another year or so for my hair to grow long enough to take advantage of the DevaChan salon experience. I can't wait. I'll update my review when I do so.

I absolutely love this book.  My hairdresser is a Deva Care specialist and has this book at her salon.  She took one of the models and colored my hair after it, I got so many compliments.  This is a simple, non technical step by step on what to do with your curly hair!  My hair has always been crazy since I was a kid, my husband calls me Bob Marley, but he LOVES my curly hair.  This book has made ME love my curly hair.  Because you probably know how it is, that everyone says how they love your curly hair but you don't love it?  This book teaches you how to LOVE your curly hair.

i have fine, color treated, medium thick, 2a/b hair. this handbook helped me find the best washing and styling methods to bring out my natural waves! so much info you didn't even know in here. also has tips on how to make masks at home, hair cutting tips for your hair type, etc. i have read it twice.

It may sound a little overly dramatic, but this book changed my life (I first discovered it under the first edition)!  Before I found this book, I battled with super frizz and super unruly/unpredictable hair that my straight-haired mother and sister had no clue what to do with.  After reading this book, I learned how to take care of my "Botticelli" curls and now have minimum frizz and tons of compliments!  It makes sense that someone with curly hair have a completely different hair routine than someone with straight hair.  I got a few jeers and sideways glances when people found out I didn't use shampoo after reading this book; however, the results spoke for themselves as my hair transformed into its natural splendor.  And I never once had someone complain that my hair smelled bad because I used conditioner in the place of shampoo...quiet the opposite, actually!  I had a guy in high school who told me he loved sitting behind me because my hair always smelled so nice.  A little creepy, but it just proves the point that you won't be "gross," "nasty," or "smelly" if you ditch the harsh sulfate-salt-laden common shampoos for this "Curly Girl Method" of cultivating your curls!

For one of my 2019 resolutions, I wanted to figure out what to do about my frizzy, dry hair. I was so sick of it and tired of not knowing what to do about it. (I’ve battled it for nearly 40 years now!!) So I ordered  This book, read it in two days front to back and then started following the directions for my Botticelli curls. It has revolutionized the way I style and care for my hair. It has taken My usually dry, frizzy hair—especially in the winter— from utterly unmanageable and always-up-in-a-bun-or-ponytail to wow, I can actually wear it down now. If you have curly hair that has stumped you all your life, buy this book. It’s the best book for curly girls ever!

This is an excellent book for beginners. My hair started getting curly after menopause.  I didn't realize how curly it was until I grew it out after years of short hair, that I dried naturally, with a little mousse and scrunching.  This book has helped me learn how to care for my longer hair without using a lot of heat.

This book is written well, easy to read with good information and  nice pictures. It helped my hair go from frizzy to curly and I am very thankful for the help!  (Although it is nothing to do with the book I must add I do not care for any of the devacurl hair products).

I really enjoyed this book. Although there were some sections that didn't really apply to me, they were still interesting to read since they could be applicable later in life. The tips and methods that were given in this book has been changing the way my hair looks for the better. Image problems because of crazy hair that I have struggled with for a long time have finally been solved with the help of this book! I will be carrying these practices with me for the rest of my life.

The book is fabulous... don't buy the e-book expecting the video and multimedia content to work.. I've tried it on many devices, and none of them work.  Additionally, most of the photos are very small no matter what device I view them on... but the advice in the book is good all the same.Having a daughter whose hair type is exactly like mine was when I was her age, I feel that there's a good chance that her hair will eventually turn into beautiful waves like mine did... Although I love my wavy hair, I have no idea how to take care of it and mostly wear it straight.  Until recently, hair with any type of bend or curl to it was out of style and seen as unruly and unprofessional, but it's time for me to figure out how to take care of my own hair and embrace it so I can help her fall in love with hers.  I found this method on a few forums and all of them urged you to read the book to find out for yourself.  I'm calling this a jumping-off point because curls have a mind of their own and you need to figure out what works for yours in order to make it look and feel its best.  Many girls start here and find other things to add to it to make them feel their best.
I love this book.  It is well written.  The only thing is that mine did not come with the DVD.  But that's OK.  I learned how to do the Curly Girl method on YouTube!

This book is life changing! For the first time in my 60 years I can see the true beauty of naturally curly hair, something I've shamefully hidden with short haircuts and blow dryers. This book covers the politics, science, & psychology of having curly hair. It will show you how to appreciate, grow, & maintain healthy & beautiful curly hair. It is packed with the most unexpected and surprising information about the destructive nature of commercial shampoos and other damaging "beauty" product ingredients. You will be amazed!The plethora of pictures, illustrations, personal stories, and recipes for making your own maintenance products are very helpful. I am letting my hair grow out for the first time in 52 years! To hell with shame, hiding, and narrow minded beauty standards! This book is a heartfelt gift to all of us who grew up fighting and struggling against the gift bestowed us. It is strangely exhilarating to anticipate "coming out curly" for all the world to see! Can't wait 'til my hair gets longer!Gotta go - am ordering this book for several curly friends! Already spreading the word! This book is worth it's weight in gold! Many thanks & blessings to the authors! Viva la curly girls!

The book gives the reader practical advice regarding how to manipulate your curlies.  The only problem I have with it is the "trickle" form of rinsing.  (Not sure it's actually called that, but if you read it you will see what I mean.) Rinsing your hair with splashes of water is just not efficient, and one ends up with more conditioner left than one would really want.  However, everything else in this book will help curly girls, including Bender's own way of typing your hair.  No "3A" or "3B" here. The book includes a short DVD in which the basic method is demonstrated and explained.  Don't think that the DVD is all you need.  The book itself is energetic and practical, and it got this curly girl to try new things.  I must admit that in conjunction with the book, I had my first Deva cut (fantastic), and I am now using Deva products, which are great.

I am so pleased that I bought this book as recommended to me from a friend. when I received it I read through it immediately to begin "living" as a curly girl! There is so much information provided within these pages to get you started along with a very useful section on FAQ's and an excellent DVD is also included. To start, you have to find out which type of curly girl you are and you are set from there. I love that the author offers homemade hair recipes and even those too turned out to work great on my hair. Mind you, you have to be patient if you really want to yield those curly results as your hair has been used to be brushed, colored, and most likely overly processed. I have to also say, that when I read the section on tossing out my combs and brushes that I was more than a bit apprehensive to doing so, however, I did not hesitate and threw them out same day and have not regretted it at all! My hair is stronger and more healthy then it's ever been! I highly recommend this book to anyone!

My hair spirit animal. I have been fighting with my curly hair for as long as I can remember. I tried all different haircuts, tried straightening it, I even cut it all off at one point. I got a really good haircut awhile back and he recommended this book and for less than $10 why not. I have learned so much. I cut my own hair now! It always really soft, the curls are super defined and last for days as long as I put it up at night and revive them in the morning. I always seem to find new info when I open this book. I recommend it to every curly girl I meet who's hair needs a little love. I even told a lady who had adopted a little black girl about this book and she was SO relieved cause she had no idea what to do with ethnic hair, but there's a whole section in here about it!

Had heard about this book for several years but never got around to purchasing it.  Then a few weekends ago I saw a friend with curly hair that I had not seen in about a year.  Her hair looked wonderful.  Big healthy curls, no frizz, no halo!  Nothing but healthy curls.  Of course I immediately asked her what products she was using and she told me it wasn't the products but she was following this method.  Came home and ordered the book.  Turns out I was doing a lot of it correctly but just not completely correctly.  I had all the correct shampoo and I was shampooing only my scalp but not correctly so making my long ends really tangle.  Also even though I thought I was using enough conditioner my hair was dying of thirst and needed a lot more.Bottom line, today is my 2nd hair day and my hair looks wonderful.  Soft long curls, no frizz, no halo and looks healthy for the first time in years.  And that is only with one time going by her method.  I have finally found the Holy Grail for my very long curly hair!

I'm a convert! Curly Girl by Lorraine Massey has saved my "Hair Life!!"  I'm on day 5 of following the Curly Girl method and am so pleased, I gave away my hair dryer and beloved Chi flat iron in addition to tossing out my hairbrush and shampoo!  I have NEVER in my life had such tame, frizz-free, GORGEOUS hair and curls! In fact, this morning at work, an African-American woman asked me how I have achieved such beautiful hair. I told her all about Curly Girl (which is for ALL ethnicities) and the method which is so ridiculously simple.I wish I had known about this years ago, but over the last 30 years, the only information out there for curly hair care was how to FIGHT the curl - how to straighten, relax, blow dry or get the Keratin treatments or Brazillian blow out.  FINALLY, there is someone to teach us all how to care for and love our curls and what NOT to put in our hair.

I ordered this as a Kindle book because I was/am just that desperate for help with my new (started growing in curly early 2015) curly hair. The book did offer good insight and didn't push DevaCurl products at all which I appreciated. There was a decent amount of information in the book that is contrary to what my stylist told me during my DevaCut service which I found confusing to say the least. There are many tips on how to not spend a fortune on your hair which is easy to do. One downfall is that with the Kindle version, you do not have the DVD and therefore none of the short videos that work in tandem with the book. The plus is that you can check out the DevaCurl channel on YouTube and get more specific information for you and your hair. The book is short, easy to read in a day. I would say that most of the book is probably going to be most helpful for women without the kinky coily, African American types of hair. While there is a chapter dedicated to these hair types, it is just one chapter and I think you'd be better off on NaturallyCurly.com and searching reviews and routines on YouTube as there are a million for African American hair and far fewer for white women. It's not expensive and some of the tips, like how to trim your own hair could save you a ton of money in the long run.Oh...there are several small stories, rather journies of curly girls and their experiences from hating their hair to embracing it.

I have to say that living with curly hair does nothing to help you tame it. Most things in life simply require trial and error, but our hair is just something tricky. I am very happy that a book like this exists. I have taken a lot of the information and made changes that have encouraged my hair to heal, grow, and spring back to life.The solutions you'll read about in Curly Girl are effective, but also affordable! You don't have to run out and buy $20 shampoos or $100 hair appliances. What worked for me was drying my hair with an old t-shirt and co-washing, which is washing with just conditioner.To all the other curly girls out there - this one is definitely for you!

The Bible may speak to spiritual matters, but the Curly Girl is the Bible for Curly matters!  Lol!  As a curly girl, I was beside myself trying to hide one of my greatest glories under hats, braids, twists, gobs of hair products, anything to tame it into submission.  In grade school, I was called Poodle, Brillo Pad, and Bushman.  When I finally read this book, I cut my hair into a short flirty a-line, owned my curliness, and all my confidence flooded back with it!  Now I love buying this book for other girls who are the ones hiding from their own glorious locks instead of embracing them.  My favorite people to send this book to are mothers who find themselves by adoption, marriage, or whatever, completely overwhelmed by a new curly girl in the family.  My mother certainly had no idea what to do with me, and we are genetically similar in every other way.  Imagine suddenly having to help a girl that in no way resembles you!  This has become a Godsend to a lot of beautiful women.  Rock the Curls, Ladies!

It was good information that was useful but once you read it once there’s not any real reason to revisit the info. I would have liked some more specific recommendations as far as product. Probably a book I’d just check out at the library if I had to do it over again.

Turns out I've been caring for my hair all wrong! I loved this book not only for the hair care and styling education SPECIFIC to curlies, but also for the stories. I can relate to so many of them. This book helped me really like my curls (maybe for the first time in my life) because now I have a better understanding of how to work WITH them instead of constantly fighting against them. It's not just a matter of letting your curls go the way they want to go, but promoting curl with the right styling techniques and products. My hair has more bounce and less frizz than I can remember ever having before.While Lorraine does mention her haircare product line, it's not pushy at all. Rather, she also talks about homemade cleansers and teaches how to read labels so you can make better decisions on what products to buy for better results. I will add however, that I do highly recommend her DevaCurl conditioner. It's lightweight, smells nice, makes detangling a snap and is seriously the best conditioner I've ever used. I also tried a couple of the homemade deep conditioning treatments... but these I found only marginally helpful in restoring moisture to my hair. Mainly the treatments were time consuming and just made my hair feel weighted down and rather dull.Overall though, the usefulness of this book (for frustrated curly girls and guys) cannot be overstated. After replacing all the haircare products in our house with a brand that uses more natural ingredients, and none of the "ingredients to avoid", even my teenage son (who has shaggy, longish hair and wild curls) has seen an improvement in how much more manageable his hair is.An easy read and worth every penny. I wish it had been around 25 years ago.

This is a must read for every girl with curls who has ever been dismayed by frizz, longed for straight hair or felt she was losing a battle against her curls.  At last I have the hair I have always wanted!  I was an immediate convert when I read the book and saw results with my hair even before I switched my products to sulfate free - just by changing my techniques.  I can't say how long it will take to see results on damaged hair.  My hair was already fairly healthy as I rarely blow dried it anyway and was shampooing only weekly.  But even healthy, I hated it.  Frizz was my every day nemesis.  Winter dry frizz, summer humid frizz, windy frizz, etc.  Can't say I never have frizz now, but I absolultely have gorgeous curls that make me smile every time I see them.  Thanks Lorraine!!! and thanks to Chuck, my amazing hair guy who pointed me in the right direction!!!

Love this book! Great practical tips on taking care of different types of curls. Also information on why we should embrace how our hair was made to be. Recommend  for anyone with slightly wavy to super curly hair. The methods have already transformed my hair in a week.

This book changed the way I feel about my hair and my image.Like many of the other commenters here I too did a purge shortly after reading through this book the first time; I threw out all of my drug store 'curly' products that were in fact high in sulphates. I looked up a curly girl salon and tried my hand at mixing my own moisturizers. Within just a week I was seeing more shine and bounce to my hair, and yes others noticed and remarked on it too! Six + months in I'm much happier with my curls and much more at peace with their moods.I wish there were more on styling for everyday - not just up-dos - or on the right kind of salon cut for your curl. I get that we should try trimming our own locks but let's talk more about language to use when getting a full on cut!I'm ready for book 3!

If you are new to curly girl buy this edition; but, as a long time follower there wasn't enough of an update for me. I had mostly bought this edition for the hair cutting section. I was disappointed as it just highlights a trim not detailing a haircut. If I could find a professional that didn't do a hack job or cost as much as my food bill (most tend to cost a ton and are bad) then I would be okay. Even though Massey empathizes and verbalizes her many bad hair cutting experiences she still says to go only to professionals for a true cut. I know she sells a program to teach hairdressers her technique. Maybe a way to help business by not sharing in a book? I have been to one of her stylist on a vacation (AMAZING) but sadly there are none reasonably priced and worthwhile in my city.
LOVE this book that started me on embracing my curls & loving myself. It goes hand in hand with self awareness and self love and acceptance. LOVE Lorraine!

This was an easy and informative read.  I learned a lot about how to take better care of my curls and avoid the frizzy look that often accompanies curly hair.  I love how the author breaks down every type of curl there is and the characteristics and behaviors of each.I had my hair cut locally in San Diego by a certified "Deva Curl" stylist - it was a pricey adventure, but it was fun to pamper myself for a day and see how thorough this dry haircut technique is that is recommended for curly hair types rather than the traditional wet haircut.  I also purchase the Deva Curl hair products on Amazon now that I've learned what a difference they make in bringing my curls to life.This book also has a lot of great tips and home remedies if you can't afford the Deva Curl products and nowadays a lot of beauty supply companies are making products without the laurel sulfate ingredients that dry out curls.  I like the before/after pictures and stories of each person's nightmare hair stories from childhood - it's easy to relate to the bad hair day experiences I went through as a kid and young adult.

The handbook was useful in giving some constructive ways to properly take care of you hair. In addition to that I felt all the personal stories helped me to accept and really love my hair. It was nice to learn that I wasn’t alone in feeling so conflicted about my hair. Now I go out of my way to tell other curly haired girls how beautiful their hair is.

I was watching youtube video's about hair and hearing them refrence the "Curly Girl Method" intrigued me. So I looked it up and found out about the book that started the haircare trend. Definitly a good book to keep around. Tried the method for the first time and I love the results. If your intrested in another way of careing for your hair I recommend this book.

Definitely good for a launch into the curly world and how to use products. I’m not expecting miracles and I know there’s a tortuous road ahead but I feel like I have a better insight. I think that’s all I can ask for. The rest is up to me.

I debated purchasing this book because if all the information in line. I'm really glad I purchased this as all the information is in one location bwith many pictures. I wish it had a section on porosity, it's relevance & how to determine porosity. Very pleased!

This book has opened up a whole new world to me! I discovered that I have "S" / wavy curls and that my daughter has cherub curls and I learned how to care for them! I will say that I have not successfully switched to the curly girl "no-poo" method though. But I have cut out sulfates ect ect like this book recommends! Tuns of tips and tricks in this book still waiting for me to try and enhance my curl game!

I am growing my hair back in after going through chemo.  I have curls like I did when I was young, before I started coloring my hair and it straightened and thinned.As I am discovering how to care for the curls I bought this book to see if it would help me.I am happy to say that it has many tips and tricks for the newly curly.  I guess if you have had curly hair for a while then  you know that you should not use a towel on your hair as it pulls and ruffled the cuticles.  I did not know I should treat my hair like fragile lace or cashmere.I really liked this book and it is much cheaper than all the wrong products I have tried, mainly the ones with silicones. Who knew?  I have very fine curly wavy hair, it is now a 2C I think, still learning. :)

This little book is very handy to have if you are a curly girl! This book introduces the Curly Girl Method which is a huge breakthrough for all of us who grew up with unmanageable frizzy hair! As with many things, you have to use the information with care and do what works for you and reject what does not. I am glad I bought it and refer to it often. I have it 4 stars instead of 5 because I feel it could be a bit more dense on information with fewer personal experience stories. Also, I purchased the Kindle Edition and the audio does not work on the videos. All in all, however, a worthwhile purchase for anyone, male or female, child or adult, with curly hair!

Great, informative, chocked full of information. You just have to get passed the redundant, self-help style affirmations that are scattered throughout. Has each curl variations and their routines, product for and fonts, and recipes on how to make your own product. This is the best way to reinvigorate your hair and get it healthy.

Not to oversell this book, but it has changed my life. I once fought my curls with all that I had and thanks to this book I am learning to love my curls again. The newer 2nd edition is great because it is up to date and relevant for today's market of hair care products. It provides great pictures and instructions for each care and styling technique. The information is comprehensive for "white girl" curls, wavy hair, kinky "ethnic" curls, children's curls, men with curls, and even "chemo-curls" for those who have lost their hair to cancer treatments and are dealing with the hair that is growing back. There is information on what to look for and what to avoid in hair care products, information on how to trim your hair yourself, recipes for homemade hair treatments, styling ideas, the list goes on!The new edition also has a DVD which shows you what the book tells you. It is a helpful supplement to the book. My only complaint with the DVD is that the videos seem a bit rushed and I wish they would have taken their time presenting the information. However since everything that is in the video is also in the book, you can still get all the information.Honestly, if you have curly or wavy hair, get this book. Even if you do not follow the techniques completely, you will benefit from all the information in the book as well as the great "Curl Confessions" -- stories from fellow curly haired people that make you feel like you are not only battling with your hair. The book was the best $10 bucks I've spent in a long time.

I'm a curly haired girl, and the one thing I got from the book beyond all the different tools, and techniques on how to beautify your beautiful curls, is that acceptance is key! It comes with a DVD, and affordable enough, that even if you know most of the tips, and tricks from dealing with your own curly hair throughout the years, it gave me the affirmation I needed to accept my curly hair, but that doesn't mean I don't like to change it up with a flat iron, and a comb occassionally, but I definitely wear my hair curly more frequently these days!The book was the validation I needed to know it's okay to be a curly girl! Remember: "Acceptance is key! And, once you accept your'-curly hair, you'll luv your' hair more than you ever have in the past!

Every woman or man starting their curly hair journey needs this book! Curly Girl: The Handbook gives you the basic tools you need to get your hair where you want it to be! I’ve recommended it to many people. Also, I love the fact that it comes with a tutorial DVD!

As a CGM beginner I find this book a treasure of info. I’ve learned how to read product labels, trim & properly care for my own 3a hair. Highly recommend to beginners or as a refresher to more experienced. There’s a lot of great info in this book!

Useful book. I've had a hangup (who doesn't) about not wanting to look like my mum, all my life. After reading this book I embraced curly hair and tried to go with it, not against it. All that hair drying while scrunching my hair ended up taking more time than simply not caring if my hair was curly or straight or someplace between. lol.Beauty and fashion books are wasted on me. However this book had the power to at least make me try to do something with my hair for all of six months until I gave up. For that it must have impressed me at the time i read it, so I'm giving it five stars. ;-)

Messed with my curly hair for years, always gave up and used curlers, flat irons, or just wore ponytails. NOW there is some order to my curls and life is so much easier without spending hours messing with my hair every day! Thanks!

I straightened my hair for over 10 years and I just wanted relief from it. My friend bought it for her daughter and told me to give it a try. The book is very sympathetic to those of use who's hair just seems so messy. Great tips for washing and caring for your hair. It turns out my hair has more curl to the waves than I knew! I have received a LOT of compliments on my hair since I started using her method for caring for it. From her instructions, I even cut my OWN hair for the first time. Soon after my crazy hair cutting experience, a barber (that specializes) in curly hair, said how much he likes my hair and that I should never change it!!! I totally blushed!

I'm 55 years old and thought my hair was getting less curly as I got older.  Wrong!  I probably had so much product built up my hair wouldn't curl properly anymore.  Thanks to this book, now I know what products I can and can't use on my curly hair.  My curls are full and bouncy again!

How did I manage to live 44 years on this earth and not know the secret to caring for my fabulous curly hair?!This book showed me how to wash it, condition it, style it and even cut it if I were so inclined. My eyes are opened and I have fallen in love with my crazy curls!If you have curls of any kind, or even wavy hair, this is a MUST read. Truly it is.

It's a hit where as the author provides good understanding of the characteristics of curly hair and how those who struggled with it have come to embrace their tresses. It's a miss because the information is more general than specific.  It include information for various ethnic hair types but not in great detail. Americans from the black culture or other ethnic groups (African, Caribbean, Cuban,French)who are not Caucasian will find general not specific information regarding their hair types especially for natural hair gurus. YouTube is a better source to find information for those looking for great information for natural hair tutorials, product reviews',and how to care for natural hair. I give it three stars for proving good information on basic hair care.

This book helped me get over all of the false ideas of hiding my curly hair. I now embrace whatever my hair wants to do and I OWN it! Lots of tips and useful information for all curly hair types. I now never straighten my hair and damage the heck out of it because this book helped me understand my hair and it's needs. Thank you Lorraine Massey for opening my eyes to a beautiful world of curly hair. I now get comments on how beautiful my hair looks and it grows so fast now that I quit damaging it with heating tools. Love my hair now!
Day one my hair is completely different! I've had to retrain my brain, but I'm amazed already. Every Curly Girl needs this book!

My hairdresser bought this book in order to style my hair better and learn a bit more about how to deal with thick, curly hair. She let me borrow it, and once I started reading it, I couldn't put it down. It covers everything, and has recipes for "hair potions" inside. I haven't made any yet, so I can't testify to their effectiveness. Even if you don't buy the products suggested, it is still a great book, with a lot of useful tips. My favorite parts are the sections called "Curl Confession." They are about women who never accepted their hair due to being made fun of in school or by family members. After trying the Curly Girl method, they learned to accept themselves for who they are. And their curly hair too! Highly recommend.

Excellent Book. I have learnt so much more about my Curly kinky hair. First off I am African American. I have the Fractal or Zigzag curl. I have big chop almost a 1year and half. Lot of trials and tribulations. I wish I had this book from the start. At first when I started to follow the method I was scared to really touch it because of her always saying about the frizz it would created so I would end up with stiff hair and lots of shrinkage. However I stuck with it.Then I learned that it is technique. You do it over and over again and your technique gets better and your curls transformed. I thought I had tiny little ringlets and now those ringlets are big and gorgeous. It is just so easy. Just get in shower soak hair put in conditioner let it sit for awhile. I even had a dry spot on crown and did not know it until I started this method. Now it is all gone. After leaving conditioner in for awhile I just rinse a little bit now with shower I just cup my hands under shower and pour over head. Then I proceed to put in more conditioner. Hair is soaking wet and I am finger combing a lot. Separating the curls. I do not stay in shower while I am doing this. I get out put towel around neck and proceed to finger comb with conditioner in hair. Then I take gel and finger comb very well making sure I get ever curl. Then I shake shake shake and shake hair with head down and side to side and that is it. All done for a couple of days. At night all I do is put my hair in ponytails because of my hair not being long but if you have long hair you can just pineapple it.  Also next morning before I take ponytails out I spray all of the with the lavender spritz and I soak them. Then I take ponytail holders off and shake head again...Also most African Americans are questioning about oiling of hair. She does talk about it in the book. Just let me tell you, you will not need them. At first when you start this method your hair will be somewhat dry however as time goes on and your hair gets healthier you will not need it. Once a week I do the scrub just with sugar and conditioner. I also add honey and mayonnaise for deep conditioner and olive oil. Leave on hair for awhile or overnight. Hair is just so healthy and easy to detangle.Everyone raves about my hair and it is just so shiny and the curls are so cute. I have three bi-racial grand kids and I can not wait to get my hands in their heads. Already talked to their moms. They do not know how fortunate they are with me showing their moms how to take care of their curls.Pros: Beautiful curls  Easy Read  Home made recipes for conditioning, exfoliating,spritz with lavender and heavy product build up cleanserCons:Video is worthless...Only reason I did not buy book use was because used books did not have video....Buy used do not need video

So discouraged with my curls. Found this book and it changed the way I cared for, wore and viewed my curls. This is is turn helped me to accept the real me and go with it confidently. Massey is thorough in the care and upkeep as well as bringing in real-life testimonies that really hit home on every level! I will always keep this book with me.

This book was so informative, I have shared it with all my curly haired friends and relatives.  I loved the classification scheme for different types of curls and the very high credibility of the content.  Anyone with wavy, curly, frizzy, nappy, flyaway, wild, bushy, coarse, fine, or combination hair will love the book's positive tone and empowering pride in exuberant tresses.  The many case studies of curly haired girls really validate that embracing and "listening to " your curly hair will liberate you and your hair!

I just started the curly girl method. Book was a great guide and was able to help me realize what I have been doing to my hair. Can't wait for time to take its course and to witness my hair transformation. Staying committed to this!
I like this book. It's a great jumping off point for someone ready to learn about (and accept) their hair. It's not overly detailed and is a super quick read. I'll be keeping it around for reference.

This guide to caring for curly hair is already helping me. My itchy scalp is healing. My hair is picking up more curl every day. In fact, I am now seeing curls in my poor tortured bangs! I am going to keep this up for a few months, and see where my hair ends up. So far, following the Curly Girl method, things are looking pretty!UPDATE: I have used the curly girl method for several months now. Love the results! No longer using shampoo, and have found a good mix of gentle, flexible hair gels, and light conditioners sans SLS, silicones. My hair is awesome, and I'm constantly getting compliments on my curls!

This book is full of good information.  I was a 2c who had been wearing my hair straight forever!  I actually thought I had straight hair because I would always wash, blow dry and then straighten, I never saw what it could do if left alone.  After having 2 young kids, I don't have time for that, and my stylist told me my hair was curly and showed me how to style it.  Then I found this book and my hair is so nice now.  Curly and wavy, and its getting healthier now that I am not washing and drying it to death.  It seems to be getting curlier and curlier as time goes on.At first, I had a hard time going totally "curly girl" but over time I've even gotten used to not brushing or combing my hair.  my curls are soft and bouncy.  great book!

I am mixed, black-white, but my Mother has poker straight hair.  She has no clue how to "deal" with my hair.  My childhood was one long bad hair day.  I started researching natural hair and have read several books about the topic. I love my beautiful hair now and would not think of putting a chemical treatment in my hair.  I love this book so much because it is a good starting place for someone starting to work with natural curly hair.I like the fact that this book is a factual and practical guide to curly hair care without all the political agenda of the black natural hair discussion.I have referred several of my friends who have curly children to this book and even given it as a gift to one parent.  They all thank me, and thier children look great.  I have learned a lot since starting my journey, but most of the basics are in this excellent easy to read book.  Don't let your children develop a hate-hate realtionship with their curly hair, get this book!

I've struggled with my very curly, frizzy hair my entire life. This book has the best advice I've gotten for my specific hair type (Corkecelli curls). Just following the guide for the past month my hair looks better than I thought it could look.  My ringlets are more defined and I have more control over my "frizz halo".  My hair is developing good curl memory so other than drying time, there isn't tremendous styling effort on my part.  The only thing I haven't done is cut my hair dry & I'm too chicken to cut my own bangs!

I am a professional hairdresser always on the search for information on curl care and anything to do with texture. The book is a classic among curly folks and though it seems extreme in some ways- no heat, no shampoo, no silicones , etc.. I think the information in it about curl behavior and “science” is need to know info for all wavy, frizzy, and/or curly people as well as hair pros! It seems a bit dated but the info is timeless.

This book was a wonderful read, for my hair type.  It was a bit limiting, but there was a nice bit of info regarding conditioners, which I did not know.  For that alone, this book would have scored a solid 5.  However, I purchased the enhanced version thinking I could watch the embedded videos.  Wrong.  I have an Android tablet.  No Flash capability, nor can I install Flash.  By the by, cannot be installed on Kindle either.  Perhaps it's time to discontinue selling the enhanced version of this book, since one cannot view the embedded videos.  Aside from that, if you have curly hair and have always wanted to know how to better care for your beautifully curly tresses, then this is a fabulous read.

I've been blowing my hair out and using a flat iron forever. I'm tired of spending an hour blow drying and then another 45 minutes to flat iron only to end up with it pulled back into a ponytail because I went outside and it  grew to twice its size from humidity. My hair is long, thick and frizzy. I didn't realize that it was frizzy due to shampoo and the torture I'd been putting my poor hair through. I also purchased the no poo and the conditioner and the ultra gel. I eagerly read the book then jumped into the shower to try the methods in the book. My hair looks great and I've only been doing the curly girl method for two days, makes me excited to see how much better it will look with time I'm trying to embrace and love my curls, it will take time as I've spent a lifetime wishing for trying to have straight hair.
This is our bathroom read book, have picked up lots of good tips

I bought this for my daughter, who was sad after her last haircut that her curls weren't doing their normal thing. She learned a lot of good information and techniques in this book & is happy to have her cute curls back.  =)  Such an awesome resource!

This has a lot of tips and good information for anyone wanting to go all the way to curly. Some of it is elementary and self-explanatory but there are a lot of things in this book that are very helpful and that one may not know or pick up on their own. Even though I am short and straight (my hair) now, and my curls are cut off and gone, I still use some of the advice and tips like making one's own spray mist to refresh curls, or in my case, to smooth down the crazy cowlicks I wake up with. A spray bottle, water and pure lavender oil to your preference level, and you have the homemade version of the spray Deva Curl sells for a stupid high price. It's worth reading for sure.

I stumbled across a blog on Pinterest about the Curly Girl movement. I started researching what it was all about because I have been fighting my curls for more than 50 years. I got the book and began my transformation to accept what God created: curly hair! Thank you for writing this book and showing how easy it is to stop the charade of “living straight” so I and other curly girls can be their true selves. Very inspiring book!

This book is a must have for people who are new to the curly world, and people who are thinking about going natural. If you are going naturally curly, or thinking about it then this book is for you. I am a black female who has been natural for a year and I just enjoyed reading the book. I like the regimen Loraine has for all curl types. Please believe me in saying that her regimen cannot go wrong with your hair, no matter the curl type. It is successful in replenishing moisture into your hair. I am not a wash n go girl, because it takes forever for my hair to dry, so I stick with twists and twist-outs. I wear a wash n go sometimes, but I like twists. I also use this technique on my daughter's hair. It saves us lots of money on expensive products. I mainly use Tresseme Naturals for my conditioner that I leave in, and co-wash with VO5. I did purchase the DevaCurl No-poo, but I haven't got around to using it just yet. The money for that doesn't bother me too much, because I will only be washing once a month. Overall, this book is a must have and share!
This book has help me understand my wavy thick hair since it was getting dry and loosing its wave . I know know how to take care of the dryness and with time will know if the waves are coming back.

Wonderful book with many tips for wavy and curly hair.  I always thought my hair was just kind of wavy here and there.  But after following the suggestions in this book I have discovered that my hair has natural corkscrew curls.  Using the information provided has also gotten my hair into better condition.  Great book, especially if you want to style your hair with a more natural approach.  This is the second copy I have purchased, because it is a gift for a very curly haired friend of mine, who - unbelievably -  has never heard of "The Curly Girl Method".  I highly recommend this book.

I never knew I was a "Curly Girl"! Great handbook on how to learn about your curly hair and take good care of it. Now I know why some days my hair looked great and other days it made me look like a tumbleweed was on my head! Even if you don't follow all the suggestions-at least you'll get a basic understanding of how to care for your curly hair. I was told about the Curly Girl book by someone I met on Facebook (who lives in the UK) and she said Amazon had the best price on it, and the products you may need for your hair. I love this book! And I love Amazon!

I've learned a lot from this book, it's very clear and easy to read.I consider that the contents are appropriate, but i would have like it more if the transitioning chapter was longer. Other than that i like a lot.I would recommend this books and the dvd to everyone who cares about their hair, not only curly haired people, because it's very instructive and useful.He aprendido mucho de este libro, es muy claro y fácil de leer.Considero que el contenido es apropiado, pero me hubiera gustado mas si el capitulo de transicion de pelo relajado/desrizado/alisado a natural hubiera sido mas extenso y explicativo. Aparte de eso me gusta mucho.Yo recomendaria este libro y el dvd a todo aquel que se preocupa por su cabello, no solo las personas de pelo rizado porque es muy instructivo y util.

Revolutionary! My friend told me about how she had been using the techniques described in this book and her curly locks looked gorgeous! She didn't even know that I had wavy hair because I've always blow-frayed and used a flat iron to style my hair. That was my stylist's answer for my "frizzy" hair. As a result I've kept my hair in a short bob style due to the damage from all these years of drying it out to straighten it. I've always wanted to grow my hair out and now I can! Thanks to The Curly Girl Handbook I'm on my way to having healthy gorgeous wavy locks and I couldn't be happier! I definitely recommend this book to every curly girl and to all those wavy girls who have been told you have straight hair. Liberate your curly tresses and love your hair with the tips from this book!

I am a late in life curly girl so I desperately needed this book to help me learn how to deal with my new found curls. The book taught me a lot about how to treat my curls, but the products do nothing for me. The no shampoo idea does not work for me at all. My hair looked and felt awful. I tried the no-poo and conditioner in conjunction with the gel and hated everything about it. My hair was frizzier than ever before and looked dull and lifeless. I searched all over the internet for a curly girl support group to help me learn to love this product but found nothing. I'm just sticking to the principles in the book but using different products and am now happier than ever with my curls even though I am shampooing my scalp (not the ends) daily.

So much good information for all us curly girls. Had no idea there was so much I didn't know about how to work with my curls.  Easy reading & packed with real information that helps us "deal" with our hair.  I had recently decided to stop torturing my curly hair with hair dryers, heat & flat irons, so I'm glad I found this little book. Seems I've been doing so many things to my hair that were just wrong.  The book is written by the founder of Deva Curl products.

I won't go into a detailed review of this book because that has pretty much been done already. My one input into the book is this:Not the salon that I went to or the book has said what to do for your SECOND day.  How to get my hair to look as good the second day as first day without wetting and washing my hair again.  There is really no discussion of methods, only the recipes.Hence the 4 star review.

I have thin, fine, frizzy, and curly hair! I loved this book. It helps you redirect your anger for not having "everyone" else's hair and to love and protect your own To cherish and embrace your hair. I also have learned about cleansing conditioner. I very rarely if ever use shampoo any more. Curly hair takes more work than straight hair- that's a given, but if you become accustomed to to do's and don'ts the journey to YOUR beautful locks will be easier and less stressful! I promise!

Just what I was looking for. It's almost too simple. Why didn't I realize just how parched my hair was? I've tried sooo many products! I read the whole thing but focused on the nice section for black hair. My 4c low porosity hair was a struggle. I was also sick and tired of the work and time involved with twists and twist outs. They would never last for me either. I followed the method to a tee. So that meant wetting it everyday and tolerating shrinkage. Low and behold, after a while I noticed that my curls would last the next day without re-wetting! At this point I can go three days with well defined curls that's how much moisture I've retained! I use kinky curly curling custard gel (Hawaiian silky or miss Jessie works just as well) and because of that I have to wash out some of the leave in conditioner that is recommended so there isn't too much product build up.  Once in a while I do a baking soda wash with an apple cider vinegar rinse if I feel there's too much build up. But my hair soaks up conditioner like a sponge so it's not needed too often. Thanks Lorraine Massey!

Here's why, the author was my hairdresser for 15 years in NYC.  She's awesome and believe she's quite passionate about this subject as she herself has naturally curly hair.  So, it's great to see this update to her book; it gives more detailed information than the first and includes other information that wasn't.  I'm no longer in NYC  : (  hoping to go back some day soon.  But, in the meantime I am able to find many stylists who have taken her courses and know how to cut curly hair the same way she does.  In between cuts, I get to care for my hair myself and this book is a must have for any curly haired person.  Would highly recommend.

I was unsure about buying this book because I have what I thought was only slightly wavy hair, and the book seemed to be oriented more toward people with definitely curly hair. I am very glad I took the risk and bought it. There is an entire chapter devoted to the Curly Girl method for wavy hair. I only started using the method a few days ago, but already my hair is much wavier than I ever realized. I can't believe it's my own natural hair in the mirror! I am excited to see how my hair will look after a few weeks.The book doesn't really recommend specific products, only ingredients to avoid in products. It is not necessary to use expensive products, such as the DevaCurl system; I'm using only drugstore products. There are online communities devoted to curly hair that I've found helpful for identifying specific products.The book contains a lot of anecdotes from curly-haired women (and a few men), which were interesting to read, but I didn't really relate to personally, having hair that, prior to Curly Girl, appeared to be basically straight. The book is oriented more toward people with curly hair, but still has a lot of great information for wavy hair. If you're on the fence about this book, I would highly recommend buying it and giving the CG method a try.

This book was a great read! Pretty much everything I  thought about my hair over the many years was spot on. It showed me how to really care for my hair and especially my child curly hair. Can't wait to put this into practice. Only reason I gave 3 stars was because ebook did not provide a video that was available to play.

I struggled for YEARS with my curly fine hair. I ordered this book after having my hair cut by a Deva-certified professional. The new cut in conjunction with new products (yes the overly priced Deva line, until I find something better/cheaper that is) and a new way of thinking has resulted in my hair finally looking the way I deserve it to. It's vibrant and bouncy, and even in the daily FL heat and humidity it retains its shape well. I'm still experimenting with products, styling techniques and homemade potions based on what's in this book, and I expect over the next few years to really nail down what works for my hair based on the info (and attitude) I learned in Curly Girl.

I bought this book two weeks ago at Barnes and Nobles and then ordered copies on Amazon for my friends. This is a wonderful resource for all hair types. I'm a Black female with corkicelli/(3b) curly hair and found the tips on how to wash and condition my hair so helpful. I learned that I've been mistreating my hair for years. Lorraine discusses trimming your curls at home, natural home conditioning potions and learning to work with your hair's natural curl pattern. Also, I highly recommend that you buy the book with the instructional DVD. Both of my friends called me to tell me how helpful this book it. This has become my go-to book and will continue to recommend or give it away to my newly natural friends and family.
I love the book but the deciding factor was the promised DVD which I did not get.

The curly hair world can be awful. There are many things I had no idea about, such as taking care of and styling wavy, curly hair.  This book was a big help along with you tube.  If you are starting your curly - wavy hair journey, buy this book, very helpful.

This book was a great find!  I have  typically  wavy/slight curly hair but recently made the mistake of getting a perm.  Now my  hair is  dry and frizzy.  I'm hoping the tips in this book will help me add moisture back and redefine the curls I was hoping for.  I did buy  several of the Devacare products but unlike one of the other  reviewers...I didn't find this book  was written to promote them (maybe a previous edition?).  I had to  go searching for them online (through Amazon Prime).  I'm anxious to try them and will post reviews  after I use them a few times.

This book echoed a lot of my own feelings about my curly hair-- not the parts about being traumatized, but the parts about you don't have to straighten your hair to look nice, you can be proud of your own hair, and knowing healthy hair is beautiful hair. I liked the tips for how to cut your own hair. I cut mine, and everyone at work was shocked I did it. They all said it looked great! I tried her cleansing technique for my style curls, and it really did look better. It's a bit time consuming for me, but I can't deny it works. Other people even complemented my curls that day.

This book opened my eyes to the way in treating my curly hair. I recommemded this book to a friend of mine whose daughter has natural curly hair and I will keep telling people about this book.I already tried the no-poo hair cleansing method, and it works!Thank you for a wonderful book!!!

First on content- I really enjoyed the book and found the information to be MOST helpful. After struggling with my curly hair for years I now know where I was going wrong. All kinds if wrong as it turns out. I am biracial and found the book to be lacking a bit for my hair type and for other women of color. But I got the basics and have been figuring out the rest on my own. If you have curly hair-read this! If your mixed or black and want to go natural- read this! There's no book that does it all but this comes close.I features- I absolutely LOVE the embedded video in the Kindle version of this. Awesome!

If you have curly hair, even if you don't wear it curly all the time, you owe it to yourself to read this book.  Always wearing your hair curly is the repeated focus of this book but even if you don't, you will learn more about how to take care of your hair, how to get it to look its best when curly, and how to come to terms with your hair (you curly gals know what I'm talking about).I have learned to treat my hair better whether wearing it straight or curly.  I've learned to accept my curliness, even though I like the freedom of mixing it up every now and then.  So read this.  It's good for the curly gal's soul.
I bought this book as a gift for my daughter. She has enjoyed it and has taken Some of the pointers. Great, entertaining, easy to read, and something to learn for curly girls!

I've ordered many of these to give away to 'curly girls' - my go to for everything involving curly hair - from shampoos/conditioners to styles, to how to cut curly hair.  AND IT ALL WORKS.  I have saved a lot of money maintaining my own hair.  I've even been cutting it for about 10 months.

I have always struggled with having naturally curly hair. This book changed the way I washed, styled and cared for my hair and I am finally embracing and loving my curls. If you struggle with naturally curly hair, I highly recommend this book.

This was a very boring, much too long book about curly and wavy hair of all types.  There was much repetition in the book and the testimonies were way too numerous.  They appeared to be used as filler to make the book longer.  This should have been a small paperback with just the instructions for different types of waves and curls without all the fluff of the testimonies and personal stories.  Only a small portion of the book is going to apply to any one person.  You find the type of curl you have, then go to the section for that curl to learn how to take care of it.  Done!

Been mistreating my hair forever! Didn't know how to properly take care of my hair - I would blow "fry" it (using expensive/professional blow dryers thinking that would do the trick), flat iron it (again, using the best flat iron brand) or use hot rollers, use all kinds of hair products and it would be beautiful until I walked out the house and then "POOF"...humidity would destroy my efforts.  My hair was dull, never shiny, never manageable and had a halo of frizz.  I started using WEN products in January 2012, but I wasn't acheiving the desired results promised.  After 8 months, I FINALLY got fed up and actually thought about shaving my head (like Sinead O'Connor)!! Thank goodness I did a little research on curly hair and found this handbook.  I was so excited that I ordered it right away and told my curly/dry/frizzy sisters about it, too.  Boxed up my WEN (can't throw it out, yikes, too expensive) and found the DevaCurl products at the local ULTA store, not that you HAVE to use her products, I'm just one of those, if I'm going to try this, I might as well do it right. I did throw out loads of hair products that contained parabens, butane, propane...was horrified that I had been putting this stuff in my hair.  No wonder it was suffering!You can't be in denial of your curly hair...in fact, I thought I had just plain wavy hair until I started using this method..it's been about a month...I've got curls all over my head (like the gal on the cover, just not as gorgeous, YET!)  Still going through trial and error to get it right...like the book says...all curls are different.  There is a section on what to ask a stylist when trying to find someone to cut your curls.  I was lucky enough to have found a DEVACHAN trained hairdresser in the next town; having support to go all curly and get the right cut is tremendous!  Even if you haven't decided to commit, this book is a great easy read. The author's voice and sense of humor comes through loud and clear...she is so funny!  (Don't think it's corny...makes me smile.)  Also, made several of the homemade hair products.  They're great, too.
Love this book my hair is looking great very curly!

If you have curly or wavy hair this is a must read! I have wavy somewhat curly hair and one of my daughters has very curly hair. We both found the directions for cutting curly hair a tremendous help and we refer to the book often. The stories of what the author went through with hairstylist is a nightmare but very entertaining and I am sure many will be able to identify with her experiences.
I bought a copy for myself so I could give it to my new hairdresser and quickly bought a copy for my daughter. Everything you need to start on your curly girl journey.

There are so many things I've learned about curly hair while reading this book. The best part, the path to treating curly hair right is easier, less time consuming, and cheaper than the straight alternative. To my surprise the majority of the recommended products are super cheap and readily available at my grocery store. Long story short, take the curly girl plunge. You will not regret it. And that, is a promise.

I discovered the Curly Girl method on the internet and was told to order the book if I wanted to really get a good grasp of all the information I needed.The Curly Girl Handbook is well organized and gives you lots of great pictures to help you understand what you're reading. I read the whole thing in a couple hours and really enjoyed it. I learned a lot and have been a Curly Girl for over a month now. The methods explained really do work. If you are hesitant, check out [...] forums and look at some of the before and after pictures. I'm a true Curly Girl now and I love having hair that I enjoy rather than hate!

Mainly a good book for long curly hair. Not much advise for short wavy hair. Also Deva Curl products are very toxic so I don't use them. But there are some recipes to make your own hair care products in this book which I recommend. There is also advise on how to cut your own hair. I bought the Hikari scissors that she recommends, and I cut my own hair. Saves money in the long run. http://www.hikariscissors.com

I bought four copies of this book, all for gifts.  One gift was for a household member, so I use it, as well.  This book has so many amazing tidbits to offer about curly hair.  The included VD really helps in visualizing the techniques, so I heartily recommend watching it.  My 15 year old went from not really knowing how to handle her lovely, loose curls to embracing them fully because of the advice and techniques in this book.  We have been using the methods since just after Christmas, and the results have been impressive.  Both of us get constant compliments about our curls.
This is a truly wonderful book with a ton of helpful information. It was well written and I would recommend it highly to any person who has curly/wavy hair.
I was expecting a lot out of this book because of the hype and was disappointed, honestly. It didn’t tell me anything I didn’t already know/learned via Facebook groups.

Good information and helpful tips. I wish it dove deeper into the science of curls and managing them. I also wish there was more info on wavy hair... We are straight but aren’t curly and I’d love to know more info on wavy hair.

I love this book. It has helped me so much with my hair. The information is invaluable if you have curly hair. My mom and dad had straight hair, so I really didn't have anyone growing up that had curly hair to help me take care of it. I have always hated my hair. I wore more ponytails and buns that anyone else because I never wanted to deal with my hair. This book has helped me so much to understand why my hair does what it does and what my hair needs. After a week, my hair just looks so much better. After a month, I have completely different hair. I recommend this book for any one with curly hair. This will help so much.

If you have waves, frizz or you hate your curly hair, get the book and follow the rules, I am two weeks in to the rules and I love my curls more and more every day!  You will be amazed!  It's an adjustment at first if you usually don't wear our hair curly, an be prepared for people at work to continually ask you if they can touch your curls and if you got a perm.  LOL!  They are so amazed I've been hiding these curls the last 12 years!

....but I will try not to. I grew up in eastern Canada close to Lake Erie where it wasn't uncommon to see the temperature reach 100 degrees Farenheit (before they went metric) and 100% humidity....yes, at the same time. It was like being in a steam bath, a hot steam bath...with mosquitos. And I was blessed with curly hair and my dear Mum's was naturally straight.  That meant she had no idea what to do with mine. She meant well when she gave me a Toni home permanent. After all, perms worked for her! I spent that summer with a bush on my head. When I reached my teens I began wearing rollers, hard ones, to bed, so my hair would be smooth for school. Fast forward to 2012. I am a senior citizen now, living in California, where at least humidity is not a problem. But all these years I have struggled to subdue my curls. No more! I discovered Curly Girl while perusing Amazon. And voilà...here I am, a curly girl and proud of it! I ordered two books for a couple of curly friends and one for my daughter. All three have been liberated, in fact one friend said it has been a life changing experience. I am going to send a copy to a dear friend in Canada as well. Poor dear is still trying to subdue her curls. Now I actually look forward to doing my hair and I have been getting lots of compliments.  They probably think I've had a perm! Life is full of surprises and this was one of the best! Olivia Wilding

As a hairstylist with 15 years' experience, I thought I had heard just about everything related to hair. Boy, was I wrong! I am SOOO grateful to my customer who gave me this book a few years ago! It changed my life, for real! Now I actually love my hair! I recommend this book to every person who sits in my chair that has curly or wavy hair (as well as some fellow stylists!). There is an answer for just about every question or problem a curly girl (or guy) has. Even if you don't adhere to the suggestions in the book 100%, chances are that testing even ONE of the principles will help you out, and will make you want to try more!

I thought this would be how to treat curly hair. It is basically stories. Some tips in the book but nothing what I expected. I thought it would be recommended products, step by step processes. I was disappointed in the book. I would recommend to go to the library and look at the book first. I wish I had done that. I would not have ordered it.

You can get most of the information in this book free on the Deva Curl website through their tutorial and information videos fro free. I was disappointed that I wasted my money on this book when it was a repeat of what was on the website.
This book is a must for all people not just girls with curly hair all who have it!! It’s a number one gift I give to anyone I know with curly hair

I purchased this book after reading about it on the Curly Girl website. It is a good book if you are sick and tired and don't know what to do with you're curly mess, like I was.  It tells you I how to go "no-poo" and yes, it really does work. it also explains some ideas to transform your curly mess into a beautiful and healthy head of hair. I have worked with the ideas presented in this book, tweeking it according to my hair needs and type, and I believe it has helped me immensely.

This book has more anecdotal stories than I cared to read. Although very nice it just didn't have much information that I could otherwise get off of the Internet.
