If you are completely new to being curly this is a good place to start but to avoid spending cash I would just say spend some time on YouTube. I would not recommend this book for anyone who has a grip on how to work with their curls as oppose to against them. This book is also very limited to a certain type of curl. Overall it was a good read that I wish I would have borrowed instead of paid for.

Best resource for curls ever. I have had this book for a couple years now. I still reference it at times, and I always recommend and lend it to other women just exploring their curly side.I didn't go curly until my early 20's and then it took me another 5 years to accept it, and realize I needed help. Curly and straight are not the same, different down to the molecular level.This book makes it simple and easy to find a starting place for managing your curls, and turning them into healthy, juicy curls. You can NOT GO WRONG with this book.

4.5/5. Easy to read/follow. I was hoping to get specific product recommendations but I understand why there isn’t any... the market is constantly changing. Looking forward to embracing my curls. Now to find a good stylist...

Four stars because the video wasn't available on my device, despite its being a Kindle Fire HD.  The book content is great, but in this enhanced version there are videos with additional content .. and I had to use a PC to view them.

I recommend this book to anyone who has curly hair and wants to learn how to take care of it. It has helped me tremendously with learning about different products to use and how to overall take care of my curls

The book is put together well and it is definitely informative, but between the DevaCurl website and the many sites and boards and videos out there dedicated to the "curly girl" method, you don't really need to purchase the book. If you like getting your information in printed form and you'd like it around as a reference, it's worth the purchase. But if you're just looking for one-time information and instructions on the curly girl method, try google first.

Wow!  This book is an eye opener for curly girls who always thought they were doomed to live a life of frizz.  Following this advice for about 6 months now.  No more frizz--even on humid days.  My hair is soft and moist and better than ever!
It was interesting reading this book and iblearned a few things about my hair. Just started transitioning to my natural curly hair a little over 2 months and this book helped guide me.

My daughter has curly hair and a friend of mine suggested this book to me, because as a straight haired woman I wasn’t sure how to get my daughter’s curls as bouncy as she wanted them. The book is wonderful with tons of great tips. The deva curl hair care line works wonders, which is Lorraine Massey’s product line. My daughter is loving how full and bouncy her hair looks and has stopped asking me to straighten it to fit in with her friends.

I found this book to be very informative and helpful as I learn how to enjoy my wavy/curly hair.  Some of the stories I really related to as I experienced situations similar during my own bad hair days. They do refer to their products often, but I chose to use the products and I don't mind.

This book totally changed the way I cared for, and even thought of my hair. I definitely recommend this to anyone who has any sort of curl (including wave) to their hair. There's a chapter for everyone!
A lot of fluff, & kitschy type stories. Had some good tips, but honestly, not worth the $$.
If you have curly hair and are frustrated with it being out of control, buy this book. If you follow the directions for your type of hair, you will be thrilled with the results !!!

Trying to have straighter "ordinary" hair had been a lifelong pursuit... That changed several years ago when my right shoulder was injured and I could no longer torture my hair with heat, air and harsh products. I found DevaCurl haircare no-poo shampoo and conditioning products 6 months ago (thanks, Gail!) and then found the accompanying book a few months later. What an amazing difference, I have shiny healthy un-ordinary curls, my significant "bother" and I both love it.

Very informative. I wish it was longer and had more info on ingredients to look for/avoid and why. A great starting point for anyone considering letting their curly hair return to natural form. I’d argue it may be a good method for anyone with dry or damaged hair in general.
Great read but most information is on the internet. I enjoyed the personal experiences throughout the book.

If you have been unable to figure out the kind of curls you have, or their variability within your own head, this book will be the answer to your prayers!  It has ways to moisturizer, including home recipes, ways to manage, cut and wear your type of curls successfully.  I use it as a reference book from time to time, and you will, too.

I want to shove this book in the face of every curly girl I know. Everyone I know is doing it wrong. My hair is more bouncy resilient shiny luscious than it has ever been by using this method. I mean mind-blowing game changer

It is so amazing to finally know what I am supposed to do with my curly hair! Some of these things I have learned by trial and error but I lot I never knew. This book has been amazing and I feel so pleased to embrace my curls and know how to take care of them now. My hair looks so much better since I started using the  no-poo, conditioner, gel, drying towel and hooded dryer. Best haircut I've ever had!
Read the entire book in two sittings. Enourages curly girls to go natural, and gives helpful suggestions. Eye opening.

Just read the book and follow it while you experiment and get a routine down. I have been four months now not using any heat other than a defused on medium heat. I have not colored my hair either and that has helped enhance my curls. I may color my hair soon but will find someone that will use Olaplex with the color to lessen the damage. I have turned from frizz to fabulous!
I enjoyed reading the testimonials of curly girls & their journey to embracing their hair. Greats tips on healthier hair & bringing out the best in your curls & waves.

i was so happy to discover this book. I am a 57 year old woman who has wrestled with her hair all my life.  I have absolutely detested my thick course unruly curly, wavy frizzy hair. I have in the past straightened my hair but my husband told me I looked like everyone else so I have tried and tried to make it look presentable.  I have always envied people with straight hair as I thought they looked attractive and people like me didn't.  I stumbled across the curly hair website while reading an article in my local paper and it has lead me to this fantastic book. I have studied this book like a thesis and I am coming to terms with living with curly hair.  I think I am beginning to like it.  People ask me every day what am I doing different and customers want to know what I do to get great curls.  My only small problem is that I live in Australia and the products recommended are not available in stores.  I am managing to source  other products that work well but i would love an opportunity to have access to as many products that are available in the US.  Lastly, I have had short hair for many many years as I always found this a better option for me but with the discovery of my new curly look I have decided to let it grown.  Not sure how long but it will be a great adventure with my new products and book.  Would highly recommend this book to anyone who is struggling to feel good about themselves and their curls.  Curly Girls Rule
Well...I bought the book cuz I just got a really curly perm and my hair is now pretty dry. Great info in it.

My daughter has extremely tight curls and I have poker straight hair.  I had no idea how to care for her hair.  A friends mom was a stylist and recommended this book.  It's awesome.  Not only does it tell you how to care for curly hair but how to embrace it and love it.  Her hair is so much healthier and has fewer "knots" than it ever had.

This book has changed my life and has saved me tons of time getting ready every day.  It took a good 6 weeks to fully grasp my routine and I nearly went back to blow drying, hot irons, and curling irons.  So happy that I didn't.  I got ready in about 20 minutes this morning....including shower, makeup, and getting dressed.  I've learned to go two, three days using a refresher mist in the morning as opposed to full hair cleansing...four if I put my hair in a bun!  The time I've saved eliminating the daily blow dryer by itself has given me much more sleep time!  I've made several of the recipes in the book and use daily.  Spot cleaning with lavender mist, refreshing curls with conditioner/water mister, adding shine to dull hair with another very easy-to-use recipe that I can't recall the name.  Anyway, if you're thinking of doing this method, buy the book.  There is much more information in it than you can find online.  Also, give yourself time adjusting to the look.  I thought I had thick, course hair that I blow dried straight and then either curled or hot ironed.  I had no idea that I had ringlets and S waves throughout my hair.  Getting adjusted to the new "ever changing" look took time.  Now I love it and embrace it.
This book is thorough and very fun to read!!! Great information on how to get a good haircut because a lot of stylists truly don't know how to handle curls and waves.

OMG!  I wish this book was around when I was a kid.  I have curly hair and this book was a lifesaver.  Lorraine has so many tips for all hair types.  She taught me how to embrace and care for my delicate, beautiful curls.  It's my bible. If you have curls, you need this book!!!!  She explains so much and opened my eyes to things I didn't know.  Don't fight your curls, love and embrace them.

Very helpful for us CurlyGirl gals who are just getting started.  Nice to have the video too.  I've watched it several times.  I also purchased this for my hair stylist so that she could understand better us CurlyGirls.

I am so glad I came across this book.  For years, decades really, I didn't know what to do with my curly hair.  Well I do now!  The suggestions in this book are spot on.  My hair is in much better condition and looks better too after following the advice of Lorraine Massey.  If you have curly or even wavy hair, you cannot go wrong with this purchase.  If you know someone with curly/wavy hair this would make a great gift.  I know I wish I had this long ago.

This book has changed my attitude towards my hair.  I have extremely thick wavy frizzy hair, but not anymore!  With this book, my hair is changing for the better (more curls, less frizz) and I have only been using the curly girl method for about 2 weeks!  I definitely recommend it for anyone with wavy or curly hair.

I have been fighting curls all my life. Not knowing how to care for curly hair ensured a head full of frizz rather than curls when I was a child. A few months ago I Decided no more fighting my curls. This book is awesome and has inspired me to continue my quest for the perfect curls.

I love this book and recommend it to every curly girl I meet, even if they are random strangers I strike up a conversation with.  I really like how the author does not push her products on you.  Instead, she gives guidelines for how to find a product that will help you have the best curls ever.  I've even given the book as a gift to friends.  Growing up with Shirley Temple like curls has not always be fun or easy.  Finally, as an adult, the book has helped me care for my curls so that I love them and be proud to be a curly girl.

I came across this book while considering a very short hair cut because I was sick of the time and effort it took to wear my wavy/curly hair straight. At first some of the suggestions seemed crazy, no shampoo? no brushing or combing? But I decided to give it a try and if it didn't work, I'd continue with my plan for a new short style. I found a DevaCurl stylist and she gave me a curly girl hair trim, showed me how to style my curls, got the products that do not contain all the harsh and damaging chemicals (silicone, alcohol, etc)and began the process. This is week three and my hair is looking and feeling great. My curls have become more defined and bouncy and I don't spend an hour every morning with a blow dryer and flat iron. I don't panic when it's raining, which used to make my hair turn frizzy. Now it just perks up my curls. If you have curly or wavy hair and you're struggling with how to live with it, you need to read this book.
Oh my goodness at 60 I have finally learned how to take care of my curl's. Thank you

Curls are wild and crazy and come in a wide range of varieties.  This book explains a lot about the different curl types and how to embrace them and care for them for all they were meant to be! Hey guys!  It's for you too!

I have finally been liberated! After reading this book I have the confidence to rock my natural curls.  I've always been told that I should wear my hair curly but I did not have the courage.  This book is amazing and I am NEVER going back to blow frying my hair.  I've even lost some weight because now I do not worry abut sweating during my workouts. I would like to see a 3rd edition of this book with an  even more detailed section on multi-cultural hair. Curly Girls Unite!BTW the products I use for my curls are:No-Poo, Heavenly Hair and Angel Curl.

I'm not quite done reading, however, I'm frustrated that I paid full price for the PC Version of this book and there's no video - not even URL links. Why ipad and Kindle Fire only when PC supports any video format?  Does anyone know where they are?
My wife and daughter both have curly hair, and this book has helped them reduce the frizziness that vexed them for so long. A great purchase.

great book to build a foundation with. you really learn how to read product labels, etc. she really tells you how to take care of your hair more than anything. if you want to read this book to gain hair knowledge and still use silicones, then that's okay too. if you do use silicones though, use a sulfate shampoo to wash them out.

I delved into this book and the methods outlined with such enthusiasm.  I'm a little disappointed for myself.Positives:  My daughters have 3c and 4a (if you are into the hair typing system) already definable curls.  Their hair responds well to the sulfate-free shampoo, feels softer after ditching the silicone-laden conditioners and looks fuller and less frizzy after donating my Denman brush - again per Massey's advice.  Lorraine Massey in her book and during interviews does not advocate the use of combs and brushes - not even brushes supposedly designed for curly hair.  In one interview, she said that Denman brushes cause frizz, breakage, and disperses your curls causing your curls to have to find their way again.From my experience, I have found this to be true about Denman brushes. I would add that using those brushes also causes your curls that do clump to shrink further onto themselves - making your curls appear shorter. But that's a different subject.IMPORTANT FOR THOSE OF US WITH SMALLER OR TIGHTER CURLS:  If you are using the Curly Girl method and have 3c or 4a curls, finger-combing your hair en masse or in two sections per the photographs in Massey's book may make your hair look frizzy and your curls probably won't clump properly.  That was my experience on myself and my daughters.  My daughters' natural curls looked better defined once I divided their thick hair and mine into more sections and finger-detangled each section separately.For my tween daughters after a month of trying the Curly Girl method, I have no negatives to report.  They have beautifully defined shiny curls, I didn't have to buy an avalanche of trendy, pricey curl-defining products to get this look.  Hair care is fairly simple, cheap (you don't have to use the $30 a bottle DevaCurl Products Massey touts - any sulfate-free shampoo or silicone-free product that you like should be fine), and my daughters get tons of compliments.  Their hair responds well to leaving conditioner in the hair as Massey suggests.For me - different story.  My hair looks okay while it's wet or damp.  The curls clump.  My hair feels soft, softer than it did when I used silicones but it's not gleaming.  It looks powder-dull and a little brittle.  I'm not sure why.  I am under 40, I don't have any chemicals in my hair.  I don't use heat.  I don't have heat damage anymore since my haircut.My hair just doesn't look as good as it did when I was simply wearing twist-outs, bantu knot-outs, braid-outs or up-do's.  The curls on me (not on everyone) look sort of dated, and little severe.  I just feel I look unflattering wearing a cap of curls (my hair is about four inches long all over stretched).  Massey said that your natural curls can make you look younger.  Well, not me.  Perhaps my hair will look better once it's longer?  I don't know.  I feel now they make me look mousy or like a throwback from an 80's poster.  This is not the image I want to project.Am I crazy?  Does anyone else have this experience?Also, should people born with curly hair only wear it curly whether it suits them or not? I don't think so.For now, because I do like how my curls clump, I like finger-detangling (I lose less hair) and I like how soft my hair feels I will continue using the Curly Girl method but I will only be wearing my hair in twist-outs, braid-outs, etc. until it grows out a little more.  Perhaps my curls will look better when my hair is longer.That said, I'm glad that she has inspired and helped others, including my daughters.

I really liked this book. I've always had naturally curly hair but have never had any special tips on how to care for it. Curly Girl gave me those tips, from types of shampoo to use (this had made a tremendous difference!) to how to shampoo to which type of curls I have. I didn't know there was a difference until now. It does show tips on how to cut your own hair, which is a bit far-fetched for me but maybe I'll try it soon. It's almost impossible to find someone who knows how to cut curly hair. I've only had two really good haircuts in my life. I wish I had found this book many years ago.
Great reference for those of us with naturally curly hair. Written in an entertaining way, with lots of photos.
Lovvvvvveeeeer it, change my whole way to treat my hair and have changed so much!

This book has everything you need to know to care for curly hair.  We adopted a little girl with cork screw curls and were thoroughly clueless as to what to do with it.  This book helped me not only to figure out my daughters hair, but I figured out what I was doing wrong with my wavy hair.  We were able to identify the curl type and how best to care for the individual type of curls.  It has recipes for homemade deep conditioners and is chalked full of know how and ideas.  If you need to know how to care for curly hair this book is the best.

I'm a man with curly hair. I've kept it very short for decades, because I had no idea how else to handle it. This book is just as applicable to men as women, near as I can tell. I've been growing my hair longer as I learn to handle my curls, using the deva products and now also the methods in this book. Now I can tame my curls even in humid weather and reliably get several styles out of it that can even survive a day at work or hours of dancing.

When starting my natural healthy hair journey I didn't know where to start. I heard a lot of good things about this book so I decided to purchase it. A lot of questions that I ad concerning my hair was answered when I purchased this book. This book is really helpful because at times when Minot for sure about something relating to my hair I def refer back to this book. I would highly recommend this to a newly naturalista on his or her healthy hair journey.
Excellent gift idea for curly girls, teens. Got it for my stepdaughter, she likes it
The method and home-made recipes are excellent (5 stars)... the stories sound too self-therapy, and that may work for other target-audience

I think pretty much every curly girl grew up hating her hair.  I started liking mine better a few years ago after doing a few of the things this book recommends.  But this book puts it all together.  And I love DevaCurl products.  I've never been one to straighten my hair.  But I had cut it short because I was sick of dealing with it.  And, while I loved it short, this book has given me the courage to grow it out again.  And it's going well!  I think I'll be able to have it long again and not just put it up or pull it back!
Was recommended this book.  Looking forward to reading it to love my curls again

If you are a curly girl looking for where to start your curly hair journey, buy this book! Like right now! It's so informative and I personally related to most of stories in this book. It's written very well. I bought this on my kindle, so it included the videos, which was very helpful. I would recommend this book to all curly girls out there! It's a must read.
It's helped me so much with styling my hair since I decided not to straighten it any more and just wear it curly.  Lots of good information and very humorous too!
Really didn’t tell me anything I didn’t know prior to reading this book.
This is the ultimate book to learn to love your curls,care for your curls, and embrace the curly girl life!! I am ecstatic to begin the journey 100%, bye-bye heat tools FOREVER 🎉

Really great book and very informative for curls. I am a stylist who works at a Deva Trained Salon, and we recommend this book to clients who have trouble with daily styling/tips/ understanding their curls. I agree with most things in the book, except, she really doesn't want people to wash their hair ever and I personally have found using shampoo (not all the time) is still best.
Great information! Extremely helpful and detailed, I highly recommend

This book is okay for curly hair but not necessarily Afro-textured hair.  There is good information (use a lot of conditioner, do not use combs or brushes, etc) and there are a few recipes (hair moisturizers, etc) but this book is basic.  In THE SCIENCE OF BLACK HAIR, you will find the same information, better methods, and SO MUCH MORE.

I have 3c tight-curly hair that is mid back length, a lot of it and fine in texture.  This book has some awesome tips, but the daily routine is too time consuming.  I can't see drenching my hair in the shower each day, my hair takes forever to dry.  Plus I don't like using gel on my hair, as even the alcohol and silicone free ones tend to dry out my hair.  If you have tight-curly hair your results could go either way.  I purchased this book along with "Curly Like Me" by Teri LaFlesh.  The combined results have been spectacular.

So many helpful hints for kinky and curly hair.  This product line and book has helped me transition from straightening my hair for many years, to going natural.  I did not know there were so many similarities to all curly hair types (African American, Caucasion, and Latino textures).  All lack moisture, it's just a matter of how much we need to put back in to our hair.  I am so glad women are embracing their natural textures all over the world.
Super helpful and effective! After you read it, find a Curly Girl support group on Facebook and get some help figuring out how to apply it.

I gave Curly girls this rating because though it speaks on all types it is referenced more for the more Caucasian group,  than African American.  It does have some great information on products and merchandise.  I hope that those who enjoy their curls in the 1A to 3B find this book category consider this book but I'd you are 3C and further kinkiest,  you may want to check out yahoo for tips or do your own personal research.

I had heard about this book for awhile, and I don't know why I waited so long to get it. I think the author does a great job of explaining the science behind hair care and gives excellent tips. She does come across as a little preachy at times, because clearly she has strong feelings about not damaging hair and keeping it naturally beautiful. The ebook version on my ipad is AWESOME. Instructional videos are interspersed in the text so that you can watch as you go seamlessly. Plus, having your reading interrupted by shower scenes is just fun...

Great and helpful advice. My mom starting respecting and working with her curly hair many years ago and tried to get me to follow. After reading this book I realized  she had given me the exact advice! Well, now I am convinced! I think back to the days when I had good curl days and a lot of the time it was because I had done a similar routine. I know I can become happier with my curls and make them beautiful and frizz-free from the knowledge I gained from this book.

I have pretty hair thanks to Curly Girl. Whenever I see a Curly girl with curly hair I go up to her and say "I just found this awesome book it has TRANSFORMED my curls and taught me how to take care of them. Check out The Curly Girl handbook." I usually get a positive response. I really should be in sales! :) I tell them about Deva Curl products. We talk a minute or two. And I leave feeling like I am spreading the goodness for all to enjoy!
A lot of good information in this book.  I've been straightening my curly hair for almost 20 years now---Not anymore!  Great tips on how to get the curl back without the frizz.

This book pretty much changed my attitude towards my hair and life in general.  Always liked curls, but didn't realize my own hair was wavy-curly.  If I just love it and treat it with gentleness and respect, it's got everything I ever wanted in my hair.  (And the same attitude applies to the rest of my life: turns out that a little love and acceptance made all of it better).  Book provides detailed photographs and instructions for cleaning, conditioning, drying, and wearing curly hair of any and all curl types.  Separate chapters on men's hair, dyeing or going gray-curly, multi-curl-tural hair, raising children to understand and love their curls, even a chapter on chemo curls.  Many materials available out there to learn how to care for multicultural hair, but this book also deals with looser curls and waves.  Go natural, lose the urge to straighten, love your curls.
Thought some of the anecdotal stories were a bit much but the directions on hair care were step by step and practical.
i'm a curly girl now for a year and a half. this book has changed my hair forever.

I'm a curly girl myself. This book offered a way to care for curls that I had never tried before and it WORKED. And I hope all curly girls can use this to encourage others. Curly hair does NOT have to be straightened to look good.

Why is it at my age, I'm still learning how to care for my body?! This book is great. I have definitely learned a lot about caring for my curls. Starting with a curl care professional hair dresser to cut it properly. Mothers need this for their curly kids. I think we all need to start on silk or satin pillow cases young :-).

Curly Girl by Lorraine Massey and the products she has produced (DevaCurl)were just what I, and many others, needed who are learning to love who they are, what kind of hair they have and how to care for it naturally.  Years ago I at a time in my life when my husband requested I not color my hair anymore, but instead just be myself, I learned how to love what God has given me and my unique appearance.  I read the book, "Going Gray", about learning to love your gray hair and it was good for me at that time.  In fact, I shared my new outlook with others when they complimented me on my hair, or vice versa. Then there were people who told me that after a certain age, women shouldn't wear their hair long.  They would bug me to cut my hair like theirs, short and spiky. I have had long hair most of my life and that is who I am.  My husband liked it that way and I looked good with it, so there was another decision to make.  Now I am excited to tell you how great it was to find other 'curly girls' (girlygirl.com) who cannot or do not want to have straight hair even if  most of the celebrities are setting that fashion.  We love our curly/wavy hair and we want to know how to care for it.  Curly Girl is the manual you need to do this.  It covers all kinds of issues, how-to's, types of curls, and how to care for them and has many "curl confessions" from other's experiences.  There's even a DVD to watch for clearer explanations, or to share with your friends. I challenge you to be who you are and check out this book.  It's worth the money.

I had no idea how little I knew about curly hair until I bought this book. It is a quick read but packed with incredibly important information for anyone with even a little bit of wave to their hair. Incredibly affordable and something that everyone should own if they have curls. Could not recommend it enough!

I liked it a lot. I was eager to read this book since I saw many comments about it online. It has the basics about the CGM and how to identify what type of hair you have. But if you wanna go deeper into detail, there is not much information about the excess or deficiency of protein or moisture and other stuff which you have to figure out on the go.

Pardon the term zealot but I agree with most of the book except I have always told my daughter one of the beauties of having cutting hair is we can straighten one day and return to curly with next shampoo. So I don't understand the opinion that straightening the hair occasionally is the ultimate evil. Variety is the spice of life and you do it once a month or less often I doubt it's going to hurt your hair.

No more straightening.  No more blow drying. This book is the ultimate training tool for those who just can't stand to see their untamed curly hair in a ponytail ever again.  Great easy to follow step by step instructions.  It took me almost 60 years to learn to treat my curly hair the right way.  You don't need to wait that long, I highly recommend this second edition book with cd.  If you decide to make the change look on their website to locate a hairstylist trained to cut using the deva curl method.
This book contains a lot of information for all different kinds of curly hair.
After 60 years of trying to control/eliminate my curls, I can finally enjoy them! The Curly Girl Handbook is all I ever needed to know... I still don't have the courage to snip my bangs, however...

Loved the info. I now realize that curls need lots of moisture and it's ok to moisture them! As it is a must for us curly folks. I realized while reading this book that Curls are curls regardless of race. They need care and love and do not see color-they can't see anything but moisture...lol! That's all they know. They only know they need moisture and tender love and care. Really helped me to break the barrier of washing hair without shampoo. Thank you! Good book but you'll still have to do research and trial and error. It is a Good book for naturals who are beginning hair journey.

I LOVE this book. I loved the original book. I was finally at the point where I was accepting and embracing my curls when I discovered the original Curly Girl Handbook. The tips and techniques in both books have helped me to LOVE MY CURLS. I honestly can't remember the last time I straightened my hair. Every curly girl should have this book; even if you don't use all the techniques, you'll appreciate the natural beauty that is you. I buy this book for just about all of my curly friends/family.
Must read for all curly girls ready to embrace their natural textures.  Great advice and tips to get the most out of your curls.

Many good ideas. I even found a local (and I live in a remote area) Deva Curl hair dresser! I need to reread and really follow some of the suggestions for better results-my fault.. It is a process. My hair is easier to manage-less tangles and feels better. I actually can do a second day and if I am pushing it a 3rd day hair which is awesome for travel.

Great book.  My daughter's hair has become curly in the past year...and I have had no idea on how to care for it.  She read the book nearly in it's entirety and even after one attempt it is so much better and less frizzy. She is also getting used to the idea that her curl is around to stay!

The book is great however, contrary to the product description pictured, it did NOT include a DVD.  This was a disappointment but the book alone is still worth what I paid for it so I did not deduct any stars.
This book is a MUST read for learning to care for curly/ wavy hair!

I'd figured out most of the info in this book on my own, years ago.  But I've been on a curly girl journey for a long time so I've had many years to experiment!  These days, it's easy enough to find sulfate free shampoos.  The botanical conditioners and alcohol-free gel, not so much.  I understand that formulations change, but a list of products that currently meet the Curly Girl criteria would be a helpful jumping off point.The author provides a section on recipes for home made treatments.  One of them, a scrub, calls for quinoa mixed with conditioner.  How, I wonder, is one to rinse that out in the shower without totally plugging up the drain?  As another reviewer mentioned, there's an annoying amount of space devoted to personal stories and useless filler.  I could ignore these things and others if only the author had provided a list of recommended products...or a web site for an up-to-the-minute list.  Had she done that, I'd give the book 5 stars, warts and all.

This book changed my life!  I think that every middle school and high school needs to have this book in their library so younger girls can learn how to care for their hair!My book came with a DVD.  It was very faded and hard to see when played.  But the book offered plenty of information so the DVD was just a bonus.

I wanted to write a review for those who already own the earlier (2001) edition of Massey's book to say that this new, updated version is definitely worth the purchase!  I had been worried that the book would repeat a lot of the information from the previous book, and, while there is some overlap, much of the text is new and the new photos and curl categories are really helpful.  I had also been worried that the book would really promote/push Massey's DevaCurl line of products, but it doesn't at all.  Overall, this new edition includes a lot more information than the original book -- and the DVD that accompanies it is excellent!I just started using the Curly Girl method about 1 1/2 months ago to bring out the wave in my hair, and so far the results have been amazing.  My hair is curlier and looks better than it ever has, and it's nicely moisturized.  I can't wait to see what results I'll get after following the method for a longer period of time!
Nothing one can’t just look ok up in google🤷🏼‍♀️
Love this book for answers to all my CG questions. Humorously written with lots of little stories embedded in the how tos.
Learned a lot about how to fix my crazy curly hair! Amazing information there!

Ive tried every product and method out there and none of them worked long term. A lot of what's in this book makes sense but is unconventional. I always noticed my hair looks awesome after 4 days of not washing it but this book told me why that makes sense for me. Must read for anyone that does not have naturally stick straight hair
The book is a solid read for curly or wavy heads!  It is an easy read with some great suggestions in dealing with curly and wavy hair issues.  Also, a few good DIY recipes.  Highly recommend.

I am completely in love with this book! I talk about it all the time to people who I know have curly hair but straighten their hair all time. I like my curly hair but never really accepted them and after reading Curly Girl, I can say I'm on my way to doing so. Really great book, with tips I had heard of but also some newer info I had never known about. My favorite part of the book is the personal stories from different people and how they felt about their curls before going natural! So if you're looking to embrace your curls and how to get them looking their best, this is a great way to begin.

Best book my wife has ever read concerning curly hair control. She has followed several of the ideas in the book and has achieved great results. She has loaned this book to several friends and they too have received several new ideas to try on their hair.
Excellence book that explains how to care for all types of curly hair regardless of race.

I bought another book for curly/natural women months ago and still have not finished that book.  I got this book after a friend of mine told me she couldn't put it down and even bought the mp3 version because she wanted to have it near by and couldn't wait to read it again. I read this book in 2 days...could have been 1 day but got the book after work and couldn't put it down.  I love the different stories from other naturals/curly girls it was inspiring.  Mostly every curly girl/natural can tell you...it's a hard journey and this books gives such great tips.  I never thought I could go without a comb or brush.  I haven't picked one up after reading this book.  Love the book and I tell everyone I can so that they can get the same encouragement and great tips! I give this book five stars on one hand: the author/stylist calls the beauty-product industry (and our culture) into question for the non-so-subtle insistence that ALL hair should be straight. I LOVED how she points out that stylists are *trained* to straighten hair, something I'd never realized before. No wonder they never seem to know how to cut or style my hair (or understand why I don't want them to flatten it!) I also love the idea that it really could have been harsh chemicals in shampoo that made my hair look like crap all these years.So I started following the advice in the book. And for at least a month, I was planning to get on here and say "the whole things's a scam!" But I was still holding out hope, so I broke down and shelled out for the Deva Curl products from this same stylist's line, which are PRICEY, and I will say, I definitely notice my curls looking softer, springier, and more enhanced. I'm still not entirely positive that it isn't just the fact that it's getting more humid where I live. But I do think there has been some improvement in the texture of my curls.My one main complaint (since I still think it's fair to give my hair a few more weeks or even months to this system and see if it keeps adjusting to no-poo) is that the book and the video do NOT come with clear enough "how-to" visuals. Particularly with the clipping technique, for example-- the tutorial on the CD shows you a tutorial of how to do it that lasts, oh, two seconds? It makes me think I might be able to find better tutorials for free on YouTube.So, overall, if you can afford this book, get it. If you can't, borrow it from a friend or the library. Or look up curly-hair advice on YouTube, and save your money for the DevaCurl no-poo and conditioner.

I wish I knew about this a long time ago.  I have naturally wavy hair, but always "blow-fried" it because if I let it dry naturally,  it would be frizzy. Even with using high-end hair products over 30yrs., in humid weather, my hair still got frizzy. When I was a young child in the 70's, I have memories of my mom torturing me while combing my hair using No More Tangles.  I have health issues that interfere with me being able to care for my appearance the way I prefer to at times & this past summer, I started letting my hair dry naturally at times. I ended up having to do extra styling so it defeated the purpose, but I started getting a lot of compliments on my "new" wavy hair. So, at age 45, I decided I will start going au naturel, but I wanted to do it the right way and started researching the best way to care for my hair to avoid the frizzies.  I came upon this book and the Deva Curl products and decided it would be the best place to start.What I like:- This book is very easy to read and understand (I read it in one night)- DVD is included- Describes various types of curly hair and best way to care for each of them.- has a chapter on treatments you can make from simple, natural ingredients to use on your hair.-Gives step-by step instructions on how to create various styles-Has a chapter for men-Has a chapter for Ethnic hair-Has a chapter on how to care for children's curly hair & how to make them feel good about-Has anecdotal stories from people about their trials growing up because others made them feel that curly hair was not good to have(fortunately I never went through that!) & how they finally came to embrace their curly hair.-Tells you how to find a good stylist-Gives info on the best way to highlight & color your hair-Gives directions on how to trim your own hair-Describes products you should and should not use on your hair and whyCon:-this book advises to completely commit to your curly hair by throwing away your heat styling instruments and brushes, and never straightening your hair again. To me, that is a bit extreme because I like to go between the two looks. However, I do agree that to have healthiest looking curls/waves, you probably should get rid of your heat styling products and brushes.I had no clue about most of the information in this book.  I bought the products I need, and items they suggested and am looking forward toseeing how my curls will start to transform.

This is a must-read for anyone with curly hair.  I spent so much time straightening my hair for years.  This book taught me how to properly care for and style my hair. About 20 years ago I started thinking about going natural. So I started using a texturizer thinking it was a bit better.  Then I read the first version of this book... and it changed my hair forever.  I stopped shampooing and started no-pooing.  I went through conditioner like crazy but it started working.  My curls started coming together and everyone started asking what kind of perm rods I was using to get my curls so defined.  I just smiled and said "None, these are all mine".  I must have leant that book out to a quarter of my relatives before I got it back.  I lost most of my books in a move a few years back and I was so upset that I lost that book.  If you are curly, a coil-y, a kinky or nappy, if you have waves that won't behave, or if you know someone who is you must get this book.  The update is amazing, especially the parts for the curly guys and for people whose hair texture has changed.

Finally...all the do's and do not's, suggestions, and helpful hints for curly hair, all in one place. I have fought my curly hair for decades because I never knew how to manage it and control the frizz and none of my hair dressers EVER knew how to really deal with curly hair. EVERY SINGLE ONE of them ALWAYS treated curly hair completely opposite of what is taught in this book. No wonder why my hair ALWAYS looked so bad when I ever tried to go naturally curly. Why they don't teach this in beauty school is beyond me! Maybe curly hair people wouldn't fight their curly hair so much if they had this information. Now I finally have the knowledge to manage and finally actually like my curly hair! This should be  in every curly hair girl's home...especially parents of curly hair kids!So valuable!
